critique: This document pertains to an amendment to Civil Service Rules, specifically concerning employment by the Navy Department outside the continental United States. It grants the Secretary of the Navy discretion in these employment matters. Given the historical context (1936), the document doesn't directly address contemporary ideological debates. It seems primarily focused on administrative efficiency and operational needs of the Navy. Therefore, most axes should be close to neutral. The executive power axis might lean slightly towards expansion due to the delegation of authority to the Secretary of the Navy.
